radiographic_examinations.findings: Mild bibasilar atelectasis; trace bilateral pleural effusions; a 2.7 cm left crural ovoid hypodense structure described as a GI duplication cyst; normal liver with no focal lesions; normal pancreas; normal-sized spleen with 1.1 cm accessory spleen similar to prior; normal adrenal glands; normal kidneys with innumerable ovoid hypodensities similar to prior; diverticulosis of the sigmoid colon; dilated appendix up to 9 mm appearing somewhat hyperemic with surrounding inflammation; no free fluid in the pelvis.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: The appendix had measured 5 mm on prior imaging.
